Posted By: kindofabigdeal (9/24/2013 8:55:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Best card in Theros. There's a reason why Jund just dominated a recent big Modern event, and the deck owes its success in no small part to Thoughtseize (and its partner in crime, [Inquisition of Kozilek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inquisition of Kozilek)). For one mana and 2 life, solves any problem preemptively, whether it's a creature, a planeswalker or a counterspell. All those times you [Turn // Burn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Turn // Burn) a [Voice of Resurgence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voice of Resurgence) for five mana or [Warleader's Helix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warleader's Helix) a [Domri Rade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Domri Rade) *after* they've already drawn a creature with his +1... if you went Swamp, Thoughtseize instead, problem was already solved on turn 1.
posts.html:
Best card in Theros. There's a reason why Jund just dominated a recent big Modern event, and the deck owes its success in no small part to Thoughtseize (and its partner in crime, Inquisition of Kozilek). For one mana and 2 life, solves any problem preemptively, whether it's a creature, a planeswalker or a counterspell. All those times you Turn // Burn a Voice of Resurgence for five mana or Warleader's Helix a Domri Rade after they've already drawn a creature with his +1... if you went Swamp, Thoughtseize instead, problem was already solved on turn 1.
